**Sunsword** is an [artifact weapon](/wiki/Artifact_weapon "Artifact weapon") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is [lawful](/wiki/Lawful "Lawful"), and its [base item](/wiki/Base_item "Base item") is a [long sword](/wiki/Long_sword "Long sword").

[ ]

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

## Generation

Sunsword can be received as a [sacrifice gift](/wiki/Sacrifice_gift "Sacrifice gift") by lawful characters. [Angels](/wiki/Angel "Angel") and [Aleaxes](/wiki/Aleax "Aleax") have a 5% chance of their [normal starting](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") [erodeproof](/wiki/Erodeproof "Erodeproof") [long sword](/wiki/Long_sword "Long sword") being Sunsword; [Archons](/wiki/Archons "Archons") generated normally have a 50% chance of generating with either Sunsword or [Demonbane](/wiki/Demonbane "Demonbane"), with a rustproof long sword replacing either [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") if it was already generated.

## Description

Sunsword has +1d5 [to-hit](/wiki/To-hit "To-hit") and does [double damage](/wiki/Double_damage "Double damage") against [undead](/wiki/Undead "Undead"), and prevents [blinding](/wiki/Blindness "Blindness") from lights while wielded. It also acts as a [light](/wiki/Light "Light") source when wielded, with a radius centered around the wielder based on its [beatitude](/wiki/Beatitude "Beatitude"): 3 if blessed, 2 if uncursed, and 1 if cursed. It will unlight when unwielded.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) The light from Sunsword repels [gremlins](/wiki/Gremlin "Gremlin") and adds +1d8 damage when hitting them with Sunsword.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

## Strategy

Sunsword's use as a light source is generally considered more important than its damage bonus, though it is a viable choice in the absence of a better artifact weapon. Sunsword does hit a far wider range of monsters than most [Bane](/wiki/Bane "Bane")-style artifacts - [liches](/wiki/Lich "Lich") and the later [vampires](/wiki/Vampire_\(monster_class\) "Vampire (monster class)") are among the strongest (and most relevant) targets, and become much more common when passing through the [Valley of the Dead](/wiki/Valley_of_the_Dead "Valley of the Dead") and into [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom"). [Priests](/wiki/Priests "Priests") face many undead on [their quest](/wiki/Priest_quest "Priest quest"), making the double damage especially useful for them in theory.

However, since obtaining it as a sacrifice gift unrestricts the long sword skill, [Excalibur](/wiki/Excalibur "Excalibur") becomes available and will almost always supercede Sunsword as the primary weapon. Players attempting the [genocide](/wiki/Genocide "Genocide")-less [conduct](/wiki/Conduct "Conduct") may still find Sunsword especially useful against liches.

## History

Sunsword first appears in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0").

In [NetHack 3.4.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.4.3 "NetHack 3.4.3") and previous versions, including some variants based on them, the light range does not depend on beatitude and always has a radius of 2; a [magic lamp](/wiki/Magic_lamp "Magic lamp") was often preferred as a light source in these versions. Sunsword was also ineffective against [shades](/wiki/Shade "Shade"), who are undead but heavily resist damage from non-silver weapons.

In [NetHack 3.6.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.0 "NetHack 3.6.0"), the effects of beatitude on the light radius is introduced, and Sunsword was adjusted so that its bonus damage against undead overrode shades' resistance to non-silver damage. The light's additional effects on gremlins were added in [NetHack 3.6.2](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.2 "NetHack 3.6.2").

## Messages

- Sunsword begins to shine \[dimly/brightly/brilliantly]!

  You wielded Sunsword, and it is now giving off light.

- Sunsword stops shining.

  You unwielded Sunsword.

- Sunsword shines \[brighter/less brightly].

  The beatitude status of Sunsword changed while it was wielded.

- Light begins shining \<nearby/in the distance>.

  A monster wielded Sunsword and its light shone within your range of vision, with the range determining which phrase is used.

- Suddenly, the only light left comes from Sunsword!

  You were wielding Sunsword while either reading a [scroll of light](/wiki/Scroll_of_light "Scroll of light") that was cursed, or reading any scroll of light while confused.

## Variants

### NetHack: The Next Generation

In [NetHack: The Next Generation](/wiki/NetHack:_The_Next_Generation "NetHack: The Next Generation"), [Sunsword]() can be requested from [Duri](/wiki/Duri "Duri") at [The Forge](/wiki/The_Forge "The Forge") for 7000[zm](/wiki/Zm "Zm").

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), Sunsword is easier to obtain, lawful characters can also receive [A](/wiki/Angelic_being "Angelic being") [minions](/wiki/Minion "Minion") as [sacrifice gifts](/wiki/Sacrifice_gift "Sacrifice gift") that are likely to be generated carrying it. Minion gifts are not affected by previous gifts as with artifacts - once a minion with Sunsword generates, it can be easily disarmed with a [bullwhip](/wiki/Bullwhip "Bullwhip").

Furthermore, Sunsword has a much wider use case due to the addition of far more dangerous undead, such as spellcasting [vampire mages](/wiki/Vampire_mage_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Vampire mage (SLASH'EM)") and [ghoul mages](/wiki/Ghoul_mage "Ghoul mage"), fast and hard-hitting [gugs](/wiki/Gug "Gug"), and regenerating [troll mummies](/wiki/Troll_mummies "Troll mummies"). Sunsword competes for its niche with the [Holy Spear of Light](/wiki/Holy_Spear_of_Light "Holy Spear of Light"), an artifact [silver spear](/wiki/Silver_spear "Silver spear") that also acts as a light source. The Holy Spear has a smaller bonus against undead, but its silver material grants bonus damage against [major demons](/wiki/Major_demon "Major demon"), and it can be [invoked](/wiki/Invoked "Invoked") to permanently illuminate an area around the player and damage undead caught in the light burst - it is also always permanently lit, while Sunsword must be wielded to light up.

SLASH'EM also makes it possible to [twoweapon](/wiki/Twoweapon "Twoweapon") artifacts, though Sunsword will only provide light if wielded in the primary hand.

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack") and [notnotdNetHack](/wiki/NotnotdNetHack "NotnotdNetHack"), Sunsword is a [silvered](/wiki/Silver "Silver") long sword made of [gold](/wiki/Gold "Gold"). The artifact uses (and trains) the higher of the two between your [short sword](/wiki/Short_sword "Short sword") and long sword skills, which makes it effective even for roles that are restricted in long swords.

Sunsword has +1 to-hit and deals double damage against demons as well as undead, and confers [automatic searching](/wiki/Automatic_searching "Automatic searching") and [blindness resistance](/wiki/Blindness_resistance "Blindness resistance") while wielded on top of acting as a light source. Sunsword ignores the target monster's equipped armor when calculating accuracy and [DR](/wiki/DR "DR"), and deals full damage to insubstantial monsters such as shade and [Sharab Kamerel](/wiki/Sharab_Kamerel "Sharab Kamerel") - it also has a chance of [stoning](/wiki/Stoning "Stoning") [trolls](/wiki/Troll_\(monster_class\) "Troll (monster class)") and instakilling [gremlins](/wiki/Gremlin "Gremlin") on hit.

### FIQHack

In [FIQHack](/wiki/FIQHack "FIQHack"), Sunsword blocks blindness, much like [The Eyes of the Overworld](/wiki/The_Eyes_of_the_Overworld "The Eyes of the Overworld"). Its double damage is replaced by a +1d20 damage bonus.

### SpliceHack

In [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack"), Sunsword is made of crystal [gemstone](/wiki/Gemstone "Gemstone"), and its base item is chosen at random from one-handed swords, including the long sword.

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), Sunsword is also made of crystal, and has a chance of completely destroying any undead that it hits. Additionally, killing [zombies](/wiki/Zombie_\(EvilHack\) "Zombie (EvilHack)") while wielding Sunsword causes their [corpses](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") to evaporate, preventing their revival.

Sunsword can be [forged](/wiki/Forge_\(dungeon_feature\) "Forge (dungeon feature)") together with [Demonbane](/wiki/Demonbane "Demonbane") to create the [Hammer of the Gods](/wiki/Hammer_of_the_Gods "Hammer of the Gods"), an artifact silver [heavy war hammer](/wiki/Heavy_war_hammer "Heavy war hammer") that retains Sunsword's bonuses and warning versus undead and its ability to emit light while wielded.

### SlashTHEM

In addition to SLASH'EM details, [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM") adds The Forge from NetHack: The Next Generation, where Sunsword can be requested from Duri for 7000zm as before.

## Encyclopedia entry

What you seek is a blade of light, a weapon for vengeance.

\[ Expedition to Castle Ravenloft, by Bruce Cordell and James Wyatt ]

Sunsword can be [[Forge (dungeon feature)|forged]] together with [[Demonbane]] to create the [[Hammer of the Gods]], an artifact silver [[heavy war hammer]] that retains Sunsword's bonuses and warning versus undead and its ability to emit light while wielded. ===SlashTHEM=== In addition to SLASH'EM details, [[SlashTHEM]] adds The Forge from NetHack: The Next Generation, where Sunsword can be requested from Duri for 7000zm as before. ==Encyclopedia entry== {{encyclopedia|What you seek is a blade of light, a weapon for vengeance. |[ Expedition to Castle Ravenloft, by Bruce Cordell and James Wyatt ]}} ==References== {{nethack-366}} [[Category:Artifact weapons]]
